0: [{"trout" : {"VAR1": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "String", "initial_value": "Initial Value"},                "VAR2": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "String", "initial_value": "Initial Value"}},    "trout" : {"VAR3": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "Integer", "initial_value": 0},               "VAR4": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "Integer", "initial_value": 0}}    }]Q:How do I get the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string?I'm trying to find out how many times a specific letter appears in a string. For example if my string were "hello world" then it would return 3 because there are three l's. However when I run my program it returns -1 every time even though there are three l's in the string. How do I fix this?public static int countLetters(String str){          int counter = 0;          for(int i=0; i<str.length(); i++){              if(str.charAt(i) == 'l'){                  counter++;              }          }          return counter;      }A:You need to check if the current char is equal to the one you're looking for before incrementing your counter. Otherwise, you'll always add 1 to the counter regardless of what the previous iteration did.Try something like this instead:public static int countLetters(String str){      int counter = 0;      for(int i=0; i<str.length() && str.charAt(i)!= 'l'; ++i) {} // <-- here      if(str.charAt(i) == 'l'){          counter++;      }      return counter;}A:Your loop should look like this:for(int i=0; i<str.length() && str.charAt(i)!= 'l'; ++i) {     //...}Otherwise, you will keep adding 1 to the counter no matter what happens inside the loop
1: [{"trout" : {"VAR1": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "String", "initial_value": "Initial Value"},                "VAR2": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "String", "initial_value": "Initial Value"}},    "trout" : {"VAR3": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "Integer", "initial_value": 0},               "VAR4": {"short_description": "Short Description", "data_type": "Integer", "initial_value": 0}}    }]Q:How do I get the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string?I'm trying to find out how many times a specific letter appears in a string. For example if my string were "hello world" then it would return 3 because there are three l's. However when I run my program it returns -1 every time even though there are three l's in the string. How do I fix this?public static int countLetters(String str){          int counter = 0;          for(int i=0; i<str.length(); i++){              if(str.charAt(i) == 'l'){                  counter++;              }          }          return counter;      }A:You need to use String#indexOf() method instead of charAt().Change your loop like below:for(int i=0; i<str.length(); i++) {     if(str.indexOf('l', i+1)!= -1) { // <-- here        counter++;     }}A:Try this one:public static int countLetters(String str){      int counter = 0;      for(int i=0; i<str.length(); i++){          if(str.charAt(i) == 'l'){              counter++;          } else {              break;          }      }      return counter;}A:If you want to check if a character exists within a string, you should use.contains(), not.charAt():if(str.contains("
